text: The 2021 Norwegian parliamentary election was held on 13 September 2021. All 169 seats in the Norwegian legislature, the Storting, were up for election. Late at night on 13 September, incumbent Conservative Prime Minister Erna Solberg lost the most seats, and accepted her defeat. Her party ended up with the second-largest number of representatives. Jonas Gahr Støre's Labour Party won the most seats and is set to become prime minister. ==Candidates== File:Jonas Gahr Støre (174622).jpg|Opposition Leader Jonas Gahr Støre (Labour) from Oslo File:Wil Lee-Wright foto Rein Traante2017 MG 0419 (32592903182).jpg|Prime Minister Erna Solberg (Conservative) from Vestland File:Trygve S Vedum kandidater Sp, stortingsvalget 2013.jpg|Former Minister Trygve Slagsvold Vedum (Centre) from Hedmark File:Sylvi Listhaug - 2014-02-13 at 18-49-18.jpg|Former Minister Sylvi Listhaug (Progress) from Møre og Romsdal File:Audun Lysbakken 2017 portrett.jpg|Former Minister Audun Lysbakken (Socialist Left) from Vestland File:Bjørnar Moxnes 2016.jpg|Party Leader Bjørnar Moxnes (Red) from Oslo File:Guri Melby (51133281858) (cropped).jpg|Minister Guri Melby (Liberal) from Oslo File:Une Aina Bastholm October 2018 close-up 2 (cropped).jpg|Party Leader Une Bastholm (Green) from Oslo File:Kjell Ingolf Ropstad (cropped).JPG|Minister Kjell Ingolf Ropstad (Christian Democratic) from Aust-Agder ==Opinion polling== File:Norwegian Opinion Polling, 30 Day Moving Average, 2017-2021.png|Polling ==Results== Party Party Votes Votes Votes Seats Seats Party Party # % ± # ± Labour Party (Ap) 48 -1 Conservative Party (H) 36 -9 Centre Party (Sp) 28 +9 Progress Party (FrP) 21 -6 Socialist Left Party (SV) 13 +2 Red Party (R) 8 +7 Liberal Party (V) 8 0 Green Party (MDG) 3 +2 Christian Democratic Party (KrF) 3 -5 Democrats in Norway (DEM) 0 0 Pensioners' Party (PP) 0 0 The Christians (PDK) 0 0 Industry and Business Party 0 New Center Party 0 New Health Party 0 0 Patient Focus 1 New Capitalist Party 0 0 People's Action No to More Road Tolls 0 New Alliance -
